title: UK Weather: Brits face two weeks of rain with chill winds, frost and fog in store
text:

It's looking like a weekend washout as the UK braces for two weeks of rain from today - and the miserable conditions are only just beginning.

Brits will be drenched with downpours for the next fortnight while the Met Office is also forecasting further bouts of wet and windy weather right up to November 9 across the UK.

A long-range forecast states that, while some drier and brighter spells are likely from October 26 onwards, these will also bring with them more widespread overnight frost and fog into the start of November.

Areas in the north of the UK, including North West England and Scotland along with Wales, will be hit by the worst downpours from today.

Up to 2.8in of rain could fall and rural areas are on alert for flooding and treacherous road conditions.

(Image: MetOffice)

(Image: MetOffice)

A Met Office spokesman said: "Rain will continue to affect parts of southern England and the far south of Wales at times.

"Elsewhere clear intervals and scattered showers, most frequent and heaviest in the northwest. Chilly in the northeast.

"On Saturday, rain continues across southern areas, reaching parts of central England for a time; a cool-feeling day. Northern areas will be brighter with scattered showers, most frequent in the northwest.

"Sunday to Tuesday will be often cloudy with rain or showers across central and southern areas, but generally brighter with isolated showers in the north. Rain and stronger winds arrive from the west on Tuesday."

There are nine flood alerts in place today, most of which are in the South West. The Environment Agency also has one more serious flood warning for the Winford Brook at Chew Magna in Somerset.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Waves have been pictured crashing against the harbour wall at Dover in Kent during today's storms.

From October 16, there is a risk of coastal gales in the north west with rain or showers at times cementing the theme of unsettled weather.

It will often be windy, particularly in the north and west, with gales in places.

Southern and eastern parts will generally be a little drier and temperatures should still remain around average for this time of the year, although it may feel colder at times in the wind and rain.

There is the potential for some overnight frost or fog, which would be slow to clear.

(Image: PA)

Towards the end of October and into November, the Met Office says "changeable conditions could well dominate".

This will bring further bouts of wet and windy weather with short-lived drier and brighter spells. Overnight frost and fog will become more widespread.

The west of the UK will be wet and windy and temperatures will be mild by day and cool by night.

The spokesman added: "Early signs for mid November indicate a return to frequent bands of rain and strong winds moving from west to east."
description: The Met Office UK weather forecast is all doom and gloom as from now into November looks to be blighted with wet windy weather and frost and fog arriving
